name: House Ramius
description: A neutral longhorn breggle house ruling the western deeps of Dolmenwood within the Barony of the High Wold. Led by Lord Shadgore Ramius—cold, shrewd, and ambitious—whose strategies seek to secure greater dominion and keep rivals in check.

domains: The western deeps of Dolmenwood and a small portion of the grasslands upon its south-western verge, within the Barony of the High Wold.

enclaves.name: Castle Everdusk
enclaves.notes: Home of Lord Ramius; most powerful of the longhorn nobles.

enclaves.name: Galblight
enclaves.notes: Hamlet of shorthorns ruled by Cabruc Lockehorn, servant of Lord Ramius.

enclaves.name: Garnack’s Tower
enclaves.notes: Home of Garnack the Horse, longhorn hedge knight who hires out to the highest bidder.

resources.name: Longhorn Elite
resources.description: Longhorn courtiers and knights under House Ramius; disciplined and politically astute.

resources.name: Standing Army
resources.description: A standing army of shorthorns and humans, commanded by Ramius’ sons (longhorn knights).

resources.name: The Thorned Eye
resources.description: A gold medallion worth 8,000gp: conjures magical darkness (15′ radius) and allows striking at shadows (AC 10).

resources.name: Court Influence
resources.description: Ties to human aristocracy and the ducal court; Ramius cultivates trust to gain formal elevation within the High Wold.

goals.name: Keep Lord Malbleat in Check
goals.notes: Ramius seeks to restrain Malbleat’s ambitions and the bitter feud within the longhorn nobility.

goals.name: Secure the Barony of the High Wold
goals.notes: Cultivate the Duke of Brackenwold’s trust to be granted the barony, supplanting Baron Hogwarsh.

goals.name: Enslave the Bicorne (Hex 0510)
goals.notes: Attempt to enslave the monster known as the Bicorne and use it as a beast of war.

goals.name: Eradicate the Drune from the High Wold
goals.notes: Long-standing vendetta; seek to push Drune power from the region and contest Dwelmfurgh.

action_library.name: Manipulate Drune pressure to keep Malbleat off-balance

on_complete.text: Whispers spread that unseen hands have stirred Drune attention along Malbleat’s marches.

action_library.notes: Grounded in Ramius’ stated desire to play the Drune against Malbleat.

action_library.name: Send emissaries to cultivate the Duke of Brackenwold’s trust

on_complete.text: A thorn-embroidered envoy departs Everdusk bearing gifts and carefully chosen words for the duke’s court.

action_library.name: Pursue a marriage pact between Lady Berryld and Baron Hogwarsh

on_complete.text: Talk of a union between Berryld Ramius and the baron’s household stirs quiet anxiety among rival longhorns.

action_library.name: Strengthen Castle Everdusk’s defenses and patrols
Reinforce Ramius’ hold over Galblight through Cabruc Lockehorn

on_complete.text: Galblight’s shorthorns speak of tighter watch and sharper orders from Cabruc Lockehorn.

action_library.name: Dispatch hunters and binders to enslave the Bicorne

on_complete.text: Tracks like gouges in the earth lead toward Everdusk—some say a horned beast is being broken to the yoke.

organization.nobles: Lords Ramius and Malbleat (longhorns of ancient stock) and the upstart half-breggle Lord Murkin rule large portions of the High Wold.
organization.longhorn_elite: Longhorn courtiers and knights under the command of the nobles.
organization.shorthorns: Serving class filling roles as household servants, messengers, guards, and soldiers.

lord_shadgore_ramius.appearance: RAMIUS A venerable longhorn nobleman with snowwhite fur, yellow eyes with red pupils, and a curly beard down to his ample belly. Ramius dresses in thickly layered regal robes embroidered with thorny roses.
lord_shadgore_ramius.demeanour: Neutral; Cold, shrewd. Disdainful of social mores. Brilliant strategist and a wise ruler. Red pupils enlarge and contract when he is displeased.
desires: To keep Lord Malbleat in check by playing the Drune against him
To cultivate the trust of the Duke of Brackenwold and be granted the barony of the High Wold, supplanting the reckless Baron Hogwarsh
Failing that, to wed his daughter Berryld to the baron
To enslave the monster known as the Bicorne (hex 0510) and use it as a beast of war.

thorned_eye.name: The Thorned Eye
thorned_eye.notes: The Thorned Eye—a gold medallion whose curious shape is featured on the Ramius coat-of-arms (worth 8,000gp). One who wears the medallion can conjure a 15′ radius area of magical darkness for 6 Turns thrice a day and can harm mortals by striking at their shadows (AC 10).

lord_shadgore_ramius.family: Widower with three sons and four daughters (including his heir, Lady Berryld, p233). Ramius is the elder half-brother (to different mothers) of Lord Malbleat.
lord_shadgore_ramius.servants: A standing army of shorthorns and humans, commanded by his sons (longhorn knights). Groundsmen, cooks, butlers, etc.
lord_shadgore_ramius.location: Castle Everdusk (hex 0410)—ancestral home of House Ramius (and of Lord Malbleat).

lady_berryld.notes: Heir of House Ramius; referenced among Ramius’ children (p233 in the source).

cabruc_lockehorn.notes: Rules over Galblight as a servant of Lord Ramius.

garnack_the_horse.notes: Longhorn hedge knight at Garnack’s Tower; hires services to the highest bidder.

origins.earliest_mortals:
The origins of breggles are lost in antiquity. They have lived
in the environs of Dolmenwood for as long as any records 
show, and were the first mortal Kindred to dwell under the 
forest’s frost-rimed boughs, in ancient days when the Cold 
Prince ruled supreme.
Ancient Nobility
The longhorns hold their distant forebears to be those 
bold few breggles who ventured into the ice-clad courts 
of the Cold Prince and pledged him their fealty, desiring 
the elevation of their own kind. These early days among
the high-born of Fairy instilled in the longhorns a love of 
all that is noble, a proclivity which drives them to this day.

sorcerous_blood.overview:
In addition to their political might, longhorns possess 
a degree of sorcerous power, derived from their ancient 
dealings with the Cold Prince. The gaze of the longhorns 
is greatly feared among the ranks of human aristocracy. 
Petty human lords often enlist sorcerous aid when attend-
ing the court of a longhorn.

drune_enmity.overview:
Following the betrayal of the Drune by the longhorn 
woman Hraigl, some 1,500 years ago (see History, p14), a 
bitter hatred between Drune and breggles has smouldered.
In the Service of the Duchy
The longhorn aristocrats are counted among the noble 
houses loyal to the Duke of Brackenwold, ruling the High 
Wold side by side with humans. Intermarriage of breggle 
and human nobles is commonplace.
Nominally Follow the Pluritine Church
The longhorn nobles and their subjects are nominally 
aligned with the Church, though their loyalty is born out 
of political convenience, rather than devotion. It is some-
times noted that the feeling may be mutual—no breggle 
saints exist within the host of the blessed.

shared_objectives.maintain_lordship:
At many points in history has an imperious human noble 
of one kind or another emerged to challenge the long-
horns’ right to dominion in the High Wold. Always have 
the tenacious longhorns prevailed, but the risk of outside 
meddling in breggle rulership of the region remains.
shared_objectives.extend_south:
Collectively, but primarily as individuals, the longhorns 
seek to reverse the trend of the gradual human domination 
of the High Wold and extend their rule further south. Each 
of the nobles has his eye on the courts of High-Hankle and 
the throne of the foolish Baron Hogwarsh.
shared_objectives.destroy_drune:
The longhorns hate the Drune for their power, arrogance, 
and long-standing vendetta against all breggle-kind. They 
seek to eradicate the Drune from the High Wold and bring 
the lands of Dwelmfurgh under longhorn rule.

schemes.rivalries:
SCHEMES
Vanquish Rival Longhorn Houses
The longhorn nobles are greatly occupied with bitter 
in-fighting, with petty familial rivalries amplified to 
blood-feud and vendetta. Each noble wishes to achieve 
dominance over his kin, whether by political subjuga-
tion, warfare, or sorcery. The longhorn nobles’ scheming 
to outdo one another largely hinders the advancement of 
their shared goals.

summary.domain: The western deeps of Dolmenwood and a small portion of the grasslands upon its south-western verge, within the Barony of the High Wold.
summary.seat: Castle Everdusk, located two miles into the woods in the High Wold region in the south-east of Dolmenwood.
summary.head: Lord Shadgore Ramius, longhorn breggle. A brilliant mind, known for his subtle strategies and far-reaching ambition. Resents the meddling Baron Hogwarsh for granting his younger half-brother, Lord Malbleat, dominion over much of the High Wold.

feud: Twenty-two years ago, unearthed genealogical documents
purportedly revealed Lord Malbleat as the rightful head of
House Ramius, through the line of his mother, Lady Shank-
hollow. Lord Ramius’ interpretation of the documents
naturally differed, and a feud ensued, growing quickly to
violence. Baron Hogwarsh (then a mere youth) intervened,
ruling that the lands of House Ramius should be divided.
